page.title: 18 THE LOCAL FARRIER.
page.content: Gerry Aslett has been working as a farrier for 30 years.He travels around the area in a blue van,with a{portable {gas_fired forge}shoeing about 9 horses a day.He is the only local farrier although there used to be a blacksmith who repaired farm implements too. His day begins at 7am.preparing horseshoes in his forge at home,& ends about 7pm. Mr. Aslett came to our school one afternoon to shoe Bumble, the family palomino pony. She needed 2 new front shoes & just a trim on the back hooves as she does little road walking.The shoes are made of mild steel & the nails are from Sweden.The {London_Fishguard coach}road once made the area an important one for horses. Fresh ones were brought from Stokenchurch to the top of Dashwood Hill,very near Mr.Aslett's present home.
